00038 
00039 #include <cmath>
00040 
00041 #include "sunpos.h"
00042 #include "tgc.h"
00043 
00044 using namespace std;
00045 
00046 void sunpos(cTime udtTime,cLocation udtLocation, cSunCoordinates *udtSunCoordinates)
00047 {
00048         // Main variables
00049         double dJulianDate;
00050         double dElapsedJulianDays;
00051         double dDecimalHours;
00052         double dEclipticObliquity;
00053 
00054         // Auxiliary variables
00055         double dY;
00056         double dX;
00057 
00058         // Calculate difference in days between the current Julian Day
00059         // and JD 2451545.0, which is noon 1 January 2000 Universal Time
00060         {
00061                 long int liAux1;
00062                 long int liAux2;
00063                 // Calculate time of the day in UT decimal hours
00064                 dDecimalHours = udtTime.dHours + (udtTime.dMinutes
00065                         + udtTime.dSeconds / 60.0 ) / 60.0;
00066                 // Calculate current Julian Day
00067                 liAux1 =(udtTime.iMonth-14)/12;
00068                 liAux2=(1461*(udtTime.iYear + 4800 + liAux1))/4 + (367*(udtTime.iMonth
00069                         - 2-12*liAux1))/12- (3*((udtTime.iYear + 4900
00070                 + liAux1)/100))/4+udtTime.iDay-32075;
00071                 dJulianDate=(double)(liAux2)-0.5+dDecimalHours/24.0;
00072                 // Calculate difference between current Julian Day and JD 2451545.0
00073                 dElapsedJulianDays = dJulianDate-2451545.0;
00074         }
00075 
00076         // Calculate ecliptic coordinates (ecliptic longitude and obliquity of the
00077         // ecliptic in radians but without limiting the angle to be less than 2*Pi
00078         // (i.e., the result may be greater than 2*Pi)
00079         {
00080                 double dAux = 0.0172021241615*dElapsedJulianDays;
00081                 udtSunCoordinates->dEclipticLongitude = 4.894969024+0.017202791697*dElapsedJulianDays
00082                                                         +5.78262765229295e-009*dElapsedJulianDays*cos(2.67824+dAux)
00083                                                         +0.03341656*cos(4.6693+dAux)
00084                                                         +0.00034894*cos(4.6261+0.03440424832*dElapsedJulianDays)
00085                                                         -0.00008339*sin(2.1824-0.00092421755*dElapsedJulianDays)
00086                                                         +0.00003934*cos(2.7441+0.01575190938*dElapsedJulianDays)
00087                                                         +0.00003461*cos(2.8289+9.64572211e-6*dElapsedJulianDays)
00088                                                         +0.00003136*cos(3.6277+0.21276871047*dElapsedJulianDays)
00089                                                         +0.00002676*cos(4.4181+0.02152065544*dElapsedJulianDays)
00090                                                         +0.00003046*cos(6.1352+0.01076032772*dElapsedJulianDays);
00091 
00092                 dEclipticObliquity = 0.4090928040395968 - 6.21395528282155e-09*dElapsedJulianDays
00093                                                         +0.00004459673713551599*cos(2.182954286987892-9.24169576470094e-04*dElapsedJulianDays)
00094                                                         -2.782663310837079e-6*cos(87.60120254057658-0.0344055570784386*dElapsedJulianDays)
00095                                                         +1.0435812166758367e-7*cos(167.41964504653737-0.0698787501985692*dElapsedJulianDays);
00096         }
00097 
00098         // Calculate celestial coordinates ( right ascension and declination ) in radians
00099         // but without limiting the angle to be less than 2*Pi (i.e., the result may be
00100         // greater than 2*Pi)
00101         {
00102                 double dSin_EclipticLongitude;
00103                 dSin_EclipticLongitude= sin( udtSunCoordinates->dEclipticLongitude );
00104                 dY = cos( dEclipticObliquity ) * dSin_EclipticLongitude;
00105                 dX = cos( udtSunCoordinates->dEclipticLongitude );
00106                 udtSunCoordinates->dRightAscension = atan2( dY,dX );
00107                 if( udtSunCoordinates->dRightAscension < 0.0 ) udtSunCoordinates->dRightAscension = udtSunCoordinates->dRightAscension + tgc::TwoPi;
00108                 udtSunCoordinates->dDeclination = asin( sin( dEclipticObliquity )*dSin_EclipticLongitude );
00109         }
00110 
00111         // Calculate local coordinates ( azimuth and zenith angle ) in degrees
00112         {
00113                 double dGreenwichMeanSiderealTime;
00114                 double dLocalMeanSiderealTime;
00115                 double dLatitudeInRadians;
00116                 double dCos_Latitude;
00117                 double dSin_Latitude;
00118                 double dCos_HourAngle;
00119                 double dParallax;
00120 
00121                 dGreenwichMeanSiderealTime = -60053.302628+24.065709825*dElapsedJulianDays
00122                         - 0.000292222*sin(0.0009242*dElapsedJulianDays+0.9574);
00123 
00124                 dLocalMeanSiderealTime = (dGreenwichMeanSiderealTime*15
00125                         + udtLocation.dLongitude) * tgc::Degree;
00126 
00127                 udtSunCoordinates->dHourAngle = dLocalMeanSiderealTime - udtSunCoordinates->dRightAscension;
00128                 dLatitudeInRadians = udtLocation.dLatitude * tgc::Degree;
00129                 dCos_Latitude = cos( dLatitudeInRadians );
00130                 dSin_Latitude = sin( dLatitudeInRadians );
00131                 dCos_HourAngle= cos( udtSunCoordinates->dHourAngle );
00132 
00133                 udtSunCoordinates->dZenithAngle = (acos( dCos_Latitude*dCos_HourAngle
00134                         *cos( udtSunCoordinates->dDeclination ) + sin( udtSunCoordinates->dDeclination )*dSin_Latitude));
00135                 dY = -sin( udtSunCoordinates->dHourAngle );
00136                 dX = tan( udtSunCoordinates->dDeclination )*dCos_Latitude - dSin_Latitude*dCos_HourAngle;
00137                 udtSunCoordinates->dAzimuth = atan2( dY, dX );
00138                 if ( udtSunCoordinates->dAzimuth < 0.0 )
00139                         udtSunCoordinates->dAzimuth = udtSunCoordinates->dAzimuth + tgc::TwoPi;
00140                 udtSunCoordinates->dAzimuth = udtSunCoordinates->dAzimuth/tgc::Degree;
00141                 // Parallax Correction
00142                 dParallax=(dEarthMeanRadius/dAstronomicalUnit)
00143                         *sin(udtSunCoordinates->dZenithAngle);
00144                 udtSunCoordinates->dZenithAngle=(udtSunCoordinates->dZenithAngle
00145                         + dParallax)/tgc::Degree;
00146 
00147         }
00148 }
